00025 #ifndef _BASE_STANDARDMATRIXIMPL_
00026 #define _BASE_STANDARDMATRIXIMPL_
00027 
00028 #include <iostream>
00029 
00030 #include <base/MatrixImpl>
00031 
00032 
00033 namespace base {
00034 
00035 
00036 //
00037 // The standard matrix implementation 
00038 //  (just allocates the elements as a contigous C array)
00039 //
00040 
00041 class StandardMatrixImpl : public MatrixImpl
00042 {
00043 
00044 public:
00045   StandardMatrixImpl(Int rows=1, Int cols=1);
00046   StandardMatrixImpl(const MatrixImpl& m);
00047   StandardMatrixImpl(const StandardMatrixImpl& m);
00048   virtual ~StandardMatrixImpl();
00049 
00050   virtual String className() const { return String("StandardMatrixImpl"); }
00051   virtual Object& clone() const { return *new StandardMatrixImpl(*this); }
00052 
00053   virtual void setDiagonal(Real d) throw();
00054 
00055   virtual Vector getRow(Int row) const throw();
00056   virtual void setRow(Int row, const Vector& rowVector) throw();
00057 
00058   virtual Vector getColumn(Int col) const throw();
00059   virtual void setColumn(Int col, const Vector& colVector) throw();
00060 
00061   // Not supported 
00062   virtual const Vector& row(Int row) const throw(std::runtime_error)
00063     { throw std::runtime_error(Exception("Operation not supported")); }
00064   virtual Vector& row(Int row) throw(std::runtime_error)
00065     { throw std::runtime_error(Exception("Operation not supported")); }
00066 
00067   
00068   virtual void resize(Int rows, Int cols, const Real& diagonal=Real(1));
00069 
00070   virtual Real& e(Int row, Int col) throw();
00071   virtual const Real& e(Int row, Int col) const throw();
00072 
00073 
00074   virtual MatrixImpl& operator=(const MatrixImpl& src) throw();
00075   virtual StandardMatrixImpl& operator=(const StandardMatrixImpl& src) throw();
00076   virtual StandardMatrixImpl& operator=(const Vector& src) throw();
00077 
00078   virtual bool operator==(const MatrixImpl& m1) const throw();
00079   virtual bool equals(const MatrixImpl& m1) const throw();
00080 
00081   virtual MatrixImpl& transpose();
00082 
00083 
00084   virtual MatrixImpl& swapRows(Int i, Int j) throw();
00085   virtual MatrixImpl& swapCols(Int i, Int j) throw();
00086   
00087   virtual void getSubMatrix(Int row, Int col, Int rows, Int cols, MatrixImpl& sm) const;
00088   virtual void setSubMatrix(Int row, Int col, const MatrixImpl& sm);
00089 
00090   //  virtual StandardMatrixImpl  select(const Vector& rowIndices,
00091   //           const Vector& colIndices) const throw(std::out_of_range);
00092 
00093   virtual MatrixImpl& operator*=(const MatrixImpl& m2) throw();
00094   virtual MatrixImpl& operator+=(const MatrixImpl& m2) throw();
00095   virtual MatrixImpl& operator-=(const MatrixImpl& m2) throw();
00096   virtual MatrixImpl& operator*=(Real s) throw();
00097   virtual MatrixImpl& operator/=(Real s) throw();
00098 
00099 protected:
00100   Real* m;
00101 
00102   // Note that the memory layout of StandardMatrixImpl is not compatible with
00103   //  Matrix3 or Matrix4 (which are designed to be compatible with OpenGL)
00104   Int offset(Int r, Int c) const
00105   { 
00106 #ifdef DEBUG
00107     if ((r < 1) || (r > nr) || (c < 1) || (c > nc)) {
00108       String ex("row(" + intToString(r) + ") or column(" + intToString(c)
00109     + ") should be within [1.." + intToString(nr) + "],[1.."
00110     + intToString(nc) + "] (debug only check)");
00111       throw std::runtime_error(Exception(ex));
00112     }
00113 #endif
00114     return (nc*(r-1)+c-1); 
00115   }
00116 
00117   void rcswap(Int r, Int c);
00118 
00119 };
00120 
00121 
00122 } // base
00123 
00124 #endif
